Courses.Name: KINESIOL 1070A - PSYCH OF HUMAN MOVEMENT SCI
Description: To obtain basic knowledge in the psychology of human movement science research. The student will become familiar with the latest theory and research from the four pillars of sport psychology, exercise psychology, theoretical models of sedentary behaviour and innovative ways to reduce sedentary behaviour.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: BLENDED COURSE: BOTH ONLINE AND IN-PERSON INSTRUCTION. PRIORITY TO YR 1 KIN STUDENTS, 14 SPACES BRESCIA YR 1 KIN ONLY. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO OTHER YR 1  STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO OTHER STUDENTS; NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0).
REQUISITES: .

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 1080B - INTRO TO PSYCHOMOTOR BEHVIOUR
Description: Fundamental concepts and theories related to movement learning and control will be introduced. The material will address many of the factors that affect the production of motor behaviour. Students will learn about the basis for movement skill and variables that can be used to improve level of skill.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 3 laboratory hours biweekly.

Notes: BLENDED COURSE: BOTH ONLINE AND IN-PERSON INSTRUCTION. PRIORITY TO YR 1 KIN STUDENTS, 14 SPACES BRESCIA YR 1 KIN ONLY. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO OTHER YR 1  STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO OTHER STUDENTS; NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0).
REQUISITES: .

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2000B - PHYSICAL ACTIVITY & HEALTH
Description: The course focuses on the significant impact that physical activity has on optimal health and well-being. Students will be introduced to, and their knowledge enhanced in, concepts in the area of physical activity and health by exploring the scientific evidence base for the relationships among physical activity, well-being and disease.
Antirequisite(s): Kinesiology 2271B if taken in 2013-14.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours. Note: This course may not be taken for credit by students registered in the School of Kinesiology.

Notes: BLENDED COURSE: BOTH ONLINE AND IN-PERSON INSTRUCTION. RESTRICTED TO NON-KINESIOLOGY STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2032B - RESRCH DSGN IN HUMN MOVMNT SCI
Description: An introduction to the basic aspects of reading, interpreting, evaluating, and presenting research in order to better understand the research process in physical activity. Measurement and data collection techniques from physical and social science areas of kinesiology will be examined using both quantitative and qualitative research designs employed in movement science.
Antirequisite(s): Health Sciences 2801A/B.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours; 2 laboratory hours every three weeks.

Notes: PRIORITY TO ALL SENIOR KIN STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES FOR CLINICAL KIN MODULE. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: EQUAL ACCESS TO ALL KIN STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0). WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Pre-or Corequisite(s): Any 1.0 or 0.5 statistics course.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2222A - FUNCTIONAL HUMAN GROSS ANATOMY
Description: A gross anatomical description of systemic structure and function of the human body, with emphasis on skeletal, muscular and cardiovascular systems. Integration between systems will be discussed using clinical examples related to sport, medicine, and physical therapy. This is an introductory level lecture course for BA Kinesiology students.
Antirequisite(s): Anatomy and Cell Biology 2200A/B, Health Sciences 2300A/B, Health Sciences 2330A/B, the former Anatomy and Cell Biology 2221, the former Anatomy and Cell Biology 3319.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1.0 laboratory hour.

Notes: BLENDED COURSE. ONLINE LECTURES AND IN-PERSON LABS. RESTRICTED TO ALL SENIOR KIN STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 RESTRICTION CHANGE: ACCESS TO NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0). CROSS-LISTED WITH HS 2300A. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of the first year Kinesiology program and registration in the School of Kinesiology. Grade 12U Biology or equivalent is strongly recommended.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2230A - INTRODUCTORY EXERCISE PHYSIOL
Description: The physiological basis of muscular exercise and training. The course will examine metabolic, cardiorespiratory and muscular adaptations to acute and chronic exercise.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 3 laboratory hours biweekly.

Notes: BLENDED COURSE. ONLINE LECTURES AND IN-PERSON LABS. RESTRICTED TO ALL SENIOR KINESIOLOGY STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0). WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2236B - INTRO TO ATHLETIC INJURIES
Description: Students will be introduced to the most commonly occurring activity injuries. Initial treatments, guidelines for referral, return to sport, and preventative measures will be discussed.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO ALL SENIOR KINESIOLOGY STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES FOR CLINICAL KIN MODULE. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE:  EQUAL ACCESS TO ALL KIN STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: TO NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0). WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2222A/B or Health Sciences 2300A/B or Health Sciences 2330A/B.
Pre-or Corequisite(s): Anatomy and Cell Biology 2221 or the former Anatomy and Cell Biology 3319 if the prerequisite has not been completed.

PRIORITY TO ALL SENIOR KINESIOLOGY STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES FOR CLINICAL KIN MODULE. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE:  EQUAL ACCESS TO ALL KIN STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: TO NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0). WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2222A/B or Health Sciences 2300A/B or Health Sciences 2330A/B.
Pre-or Corequisite(s): Anatomy and Cell Biology 2221 or the former Anatomy and Cell Biology 3319 if the prerequisite has not been completed.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2241A - BIOMECHANICS
Description: An introduction in a qualitative as opposed to a quantitative manner to the mechanical aspects important to human movement in sport, exercise, dance, and the work place. An emphasis on the development of qualitative analytical skills using videotape technology.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 3 laboratory hours biweekly.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO ALL SENIOR KINESIOLOGY STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0). WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: .
VIRTUAL LAB. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2241B - BIOMECHANICS
Description: An introduction in a qualitative as opposed to a quantitative manner to the mechanical aspects important to human movement in sport, exercise, dance, and the work place. An emphasis on the development of qualitative analytical skills using videotape technology.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 3 laboratory hours biweekly.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO ALL SENIOR KINESIOLOGY STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0). WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

VIRTUAL LAB. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2250A - SOCIAL FOUNDTNS SPRT & PHYS AC
Description: An introduction to the sociological analysis of sport and physical activity; social development through sport; basis for involvement; consequences of success and failure.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO ALL YRS 2, 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES ARE ALLOCATED TO EACH YEAR. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: EQUAL ACCESS TO ALL KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS AND NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0). WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Registration in Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2263G - CANADIAN SPORT HISTORY
Description: An historical analysis of the development of sport in Canada. Topics include methodology, recreation in French Canada, native sport, industrialization and the growth of organized sport, issues in sport, mass participation and government involvement.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO ALL YRS 2, 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES ARE ALLOCATED TO EACH YEAR. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: EQUAL ACCESS TO ALL KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS; NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0). WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Registration in Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2276F - PSYCHOLOGY OF EXERCISE
Description: The central purpose of this course is to examine the psychological bases of exercise and physical activity. Emphasis is placed on understanding the motives and barriers underlying involvement in exercise and physical activity, the psychological benefits derived from acute and chronic involvement, the situational and personal determinants associated with failure to initiate and/or adhere to exercise and physical activity programs, the theoretical perspectives advanced to account for involvement, and intervention strategies used to stimulate and/or maintain involvement in exercise and physical activity.
Extra Information: 3 lecture/seminar hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO ALL YRS 2, 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES ARE ALLOCATED TO EACH YEAR AND TO CLINICAL KIN MODULE. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: EQUAL ACCESS TO ALL KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. AUGUST 4  PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS AND NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0). WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 1070A/B or the former Kinesiology 1088A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2292G - CRITICAL THINKING & ETHICS
Description: The course is designed to teach basic skills in critical thinking and how to address ethical issues such as doping in sport, body image and gender, clinical and management conflict of interest, etc.
Antirequisite(s): Kinesiology 2270F/G (taken in 2009-10); the former Kinesiology 2290F/G, 2293F/G; Health Sciences 2610F/G, the former Health Sciences 2600F/G.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO ALL SENIOR KINESIOLOGY STUDENTS. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0).  WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of first year Kinesiology.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of first year Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2298A - INTRO TO MANAGEMENT IN KIN
Description: This course provides an overview of sport and organizational management from a macro perspective. Within this general thrust, emphasis will be placed on the managerial components of decision making and communicating, as well as various functions of management-planning, organizing, staffing, and evaluating.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YRS 2, 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES ALLOCATED TO HONS SPZ SPORT MANAGEMENT MODULE. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: EQUAL ACCESS TO ALL KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: OPEN TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS AND NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0).  WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Registration in Kinesiology.

AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: OPEN TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS AND NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0).  WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Registration in Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2991A - COACHING AND SPORT LEADERSHIP
Description: This student-centered movement class is an introduction to the knowledge and techniques essential in educating and assessing individuals in movement competency/proficiency. In this course students will explore the way people across the lifecycle learn and the knowledge and skills that practitioners need to support them to learn effectively.
Extra Information: 5 lecture/laboratory hours.

Notes: BLENDED COURSE: ONLINE LECTURES AND IN-PERSON LABS. COACHING AND SPORT LEADERSHIP. PRIORITY TO YR 2 KIN STUDENTS. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: OPEN TO ALL KIN DEGREE STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of the first year Kinesiology program and registration in the School of Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2991B - COACHING AND SPORT LEADERSHIP
Description: This student-centered movement class is an introduction to the knowledge and techniques essential in educating and assessing individuals in movement competency/proficiency. In this course students will explore the way people across the lifecycle learn and the knowledge and skills that practitioners need to support them to learn effectively.
Extra Information: 5 lecture/laboratory hours.

Notes: BLENDED COURSE: ONLINE LECTURES AND IN-PERSON LABS. COACHING AND SPORT LEADERSHIP. PRIORITY TO YR 2 KIN STUDENTS. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: OPEN TO ALL KIN DEGREE STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of the first year Kinesiology program and registration in the School of Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2992B - FIT. ASSESS. & STRENGTH TRAIN.
Description: This course is an introduction to the basic knowledge and techniques essential in designing exercise programs for beginners. Students will be expected to learn and put into practice techniques used to develop muscular strength, power, hypertrophy, speed/agility, flexibility and cardiovascular fitness.
Antirequisite(s): The former Kinesiology 2961A/B.
Extra Information: 5 lecture/laboratory hours.

Notes: BLENDED COURSE. ONLINE LECTURES AND IN-PERSON LABS. FITNESS ASSESSMENT AND STRENGTH TRAINING. PRIORITY TO YR 2 KIN STUDENTS. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO ALL KIN DEGREE STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of the first year Kinesiology program and registration in the School of Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2992Y - FIT. ASSESS. & STRENGTH TRAIN.
Description: This course is an introduction to the basic knowledge and techniques essential in designing exercise programs for beginners. Students will be expected to learn and put into practice techniques used to develop muscular strength, power, hypertrophy, speed/agility, flexibility and cardiovascular fitness.
Antirequisite(s): The former Kinesiology 2961A/B.
Extra Information: 5 lecture/laboratory hours.

Notes: BLENDED COURSE. ONLINE LECTURES AND IN-PERSON LABS. FITNESS ASSESSMENT AND STRENGTH TRAINING. PRIORITY TO YR 2 KIN STUDENTS. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO ALL KIN DEGREE STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of the first year Kinesiology program and registration in the School of Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2993Y - LIFESTYLE IND. FITNESS & EX.
Description: This course is an introduction to knowledge and techniques essential in designing exercise programs promoting individual active lifestyles. Using a variety of common exercise types, students will put into practice techniques to educate and motivate individuals to adopt an active healthy lifestyle to promote optimum health for all ages.
Antirequisite(s): Kinesiology 2980A/B (if taken in 2018-19); the former Kinesiology 2940Q/R/S/T; the former Kinesiology 2941Q/R/S/T.
Extra Information: 5 lecture/laboratory hours.

Notes: BLENDED COURSE. ONLINE LECTURES AND IN-PERSON LABS. FITNESS ASSESSMENT AND STRENGTH TRAINING. PRIORITY TO YR 2 KIN STUDENTS. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO ALL KIN DEGREE STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of the first year Kinesiology program and registration in the School of Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 2994Y - SPEC. POP. ENGAGE REHAB & EX.
Description: This course is an introduction to the basic knowledge and techniques essential in designing exercise programs for specific populations. Students are expected to learn, and put into practice, techniques used to develop muscular strength/endurance, flexibility and cardiovascular fitness.
Antirequisite(s): The former Kinesiology 2962A/B.
Extra Information: 5 lecture/laboratory hours.

Notes: BLENDED COURSE. ONLINE LECTURES AND IN-PERSON LABS. FITNESS ASSESSMENT AND STRENGTH TRAINING. PRIORITY TO YR 2 KIN STUDENTS. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO ALL KIN DEGREE STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of the first year Kinesiology program and registration in the School of Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3222B - ANATOMY OF THE HUMAN BODY
Description: A gross anatomical description of the structure and function of the human body focusing on systems responsible for maintaining the body (respiratory, digestive, urinary, endocrine), and for its continuation through the transmission of genes (reproductive system, developmental anatomy). Emphasis on the physiological functions as they relate to the anatomical structure.
Antirequisite(s): Anatomy and Cell Biology 3200A/B, or Health Sciences 3300A/B, or the former Anatomy and Cell Biology 2221, or the former Anatomy and Cell Biology 3319.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: BLENDED COURSE: BOTH ONLINE AND IN-PERSON INSTRUCTION. PRIORITY TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES ARE ALLOCATED TO CLINICAL KIN MODULE.  JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: EQUAL ACCESS TO ALL YRS 3&4 KIN MODULES AND KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE. CROSS-LISTED WITH HEALTH SCI 3300B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2222A/B or Health Sciences 2300A/B or Health Sciences 2330A/B or Anatomy and Cell Biology 2200A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3330F - LAB IN EXERCISE PHYSIOLOGY
Description: This course focuses on experiments designed to highlight the physiological response to exercise and to introduce basic techniques for fitness evaluation.
Extra Information: 2 laboratory hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN BSC STUDENTS. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO ALL YRS 3 & 4 HONS KIN DEGREE STUDENTS.  WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2230A/B. Priority to BSc Honours Specialization Kinesiology students.
Corequisite(s): Kinesiology 3337A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3335 - LEADERSHIP IN PHYSICAL ACTIVIT
Description: This course will explore the theory and practice of leadership training in how physical activity affects resilience towards stress. Focused on a Mentor-Protégé model, students will be partnered with first-year students to provide guidance in physical activity. Course topics include: leadership training, reflective practice, relationship management and conflict management.
Antirequisite(s): The former Kinesiology 3333Y.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 KINESIOLOGY STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 RESTRICTION CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS.  WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Registration in the School of Kinesiology; successful completion of Kinesiology 1070A/B and Kinesiology 1080A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3336A - INTRO PRACTICL ASPCTS ATHL INJ
Description: The purpose of this course is to provide an introduction to the recognition, initial assessment, care and methods of prevention of injuries commonly occurring in sport. The practical skills of methods of assessment and adhesive strapping are emphasized in the labs.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3336B - INTRO PRACTICL ASPCTS ATHL INJ
Description: The purpose of this course is to provide an introduction to the recognition, initial assessment, care and methods of prevention of injuries commonly occurring in sport. The practical skills of methods of assessment and adhesive strapping are emphasized in the labs.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3337A - PHYSIOLOGY FITNESS APPRAISAL
Description: The scientific basis of physical fitness appraisal; the construction and the effective administration of physical fitness tests, including motor fitness, cardiovascular endurance fitness and body composition; individual fitness appraisal.
Extra Information: 3 lecture/tutorial hours, 2 laboratory hours. Priority to BSc(Hons) Kinesiology students.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN HON BSC STUDENTS AND CLINICAL KIN MODULE STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES FOR KIN BA HON SPZ. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: EQUAL ACCESS TO ALL YRS 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3339A - EXERCISE NUTRITION
Description: This course investigates the important food/food components for individuals involved in chronic (regular) exercise programs and/or  competition, i.e., athletes. The focus is on understanding how dietary needs are affected by regular, vigorous physical activity and the mechanisms responsible for any performance enhancement/decrement resulting from the supplementation of specific foods or food components.
Antirequisite(s): The former Kinesiology 4439A/B, the former Foods and Nutrition 4439A/B.
Extra Information: 3 hours per week.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES ALLOCATED TO EACH YEAR AND CLINICAL KIN MODULE.  JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: EQUAL ACCESS TO ALL KIN DEGREE STUDENTS AND KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0). WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Physiology 1021 or equivalent, and Kinesiology 2230A/B. Recommended: Foods and Nutrition 3373A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3341A - BIOMECH ANALY OF PHYS ACT
Description: The course is designed as a second exposure to biomechanics for students in the School of Kinesiology. Emphasis is on application of fundamental principles of Biomechanics to basic human motor tasks. These principles will be reinforced through a laboratory experience.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN STUDENTS.  JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2241A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3347B - GROWTH & DEVELOPMENT
Description: An examination of the principles and processes of human physical growth and motor development from birth to maturity. Attention will focus on physical-structural growth, age and sex-associated variation in growth and performance, biologic maturation, and the relationship of these to motor-development/performance during infancy, childhood and adolescence.
Antirequisite(s): Health Sciences 2700A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO ALL YRS 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS.  JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS  TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0). WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of second year Kinesiology or permission of Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3353B - BIOMECH ANALYSIS HUMAN LOCO
Description: A laboratory-oriented, quantitative approach to the study of activities of a cyclic or repetitive nature by which individuals propel themselves overground or through water.
Antirequisite(s): Kinesiology 3343A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN STUDENTS.  JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2241A/B; Anatomy and Cell Biology 2200A/B or Kinesiology 2222A/B or Health Sciences 2300A/B or Health Sciences 2330A/B or the former Anatomy and Cell Biology 2221 or the former Anatomy and Cell Biology 3319.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3360B - EXERCISE BIOCHEMISTRY
Description: A study of human exercise biochemistry with attention given to the major biochemical pathways and their control as they relate to acute and chronic responses and adaptations to exercise.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.  Note: This course is taught by the School of Kinesiology. It does not fulfill any of the requirements for modules offered by the Department of Biochemistry.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS.  JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Physiology 1021 or equivalent; Kinesiology 2230A/B.  Restricted to students registered in Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3362G - OLYMPIC ISSUES FOR MODERN TIME
Description: To expand the student's awareness of: (1) the history of the Modern Olympic Games, (2) their function in the contemporary world, (3) the persistent problems and issues encountered over time, and (4) the research opportunities associated with their study.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO YEAR 2 KIN STUDENTS, NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0). WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of second year Kinesiology or permission of Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3398F - MANAGING PEOPLE IN SPORT & REC
Description: This course examines the strategic management of human resources for optimal performance and organizational effectiveness in the sport, recreation, and physical activity setting. Topics include staffing, job design, leadership, organizational culture, and change that are critical to individual and workgroup performance.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YRS 2, 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. LIMITED SPACES ALLOCATED TO HONS SPZ SPORT MGMT MODULE.  JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE:  EQUAL ACCESS TO ALL KIN STUDENTS INCLUDING SPECIAL STUDENTS; NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0) MAIN CAMPUS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2298A/B.

PRIORITY TO YRS 2, 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. LIMITED SPACES ALLOCATED TO HONS SPZ SPORT MGMT MODULE.  JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE:  EQUAL ACCESS TO ALL KIN STUDENTS INCLUDING SPECIAL STUDENTS; NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0) MAIN CAMPUS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2298A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3399G - SPORT MARKETING
Description: Sport is a market driven industry. Managers cannot successfully operate in the industry without a thorough understanding of the marketing concept and its linkage between customers and products. This course focuses on the strategic sport marketing planning process, the sport consumer, market research and strategies, and the elements of the marketing mix.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES ALLOCATED TO HON SPZ SPORT MGMT MODULE. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO YR 2 HON SPZ SPORT MGMT MODULE.  AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO ALL YEAR 2 KIN STUDENTS, NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0). WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2298A/B.

PRIORITY TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES ALLOCATED TO HON SPZ SPORT MGMT MODULE. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO YR 2 HON SPZ SPORT MGMT MODULE.  AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO ALL YEAR 2 KIN STUDENTS, NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0). WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2298A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3402A - INTRO TO CLINICAL KINESIOLOGY
Description: This course is designed to develop an understanding of how Kinesiology can be applied in a professional context to enhance the health, wellness, and functional capacity of clients. Students will learn the fundamentals of clinical kinesiology including program models, clinical skills, privacy/ethics considerations, with the purpose of introducing the practice of Clinical Kinesiology.
Anti-requisite(s): the former Kinesiology 3421A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YR 3 CLINICAL KINESIOLOGY MODULE STUDENTS.  JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Registration in the School of Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3412B - EXERCISE AND CHRONIC DISEASE
Description: Students will learn the role of exercise in the management of chronic disease. Chronic diseases include: metabolic, cardiovascular and pulmonary diseases, cancer. The implications of performing safe/effective exercise prescription and evaluation will be considered. Physical activity guidelines will be examined within the context of Professional Kinesiology and clinical practice.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YRS 3&4 CLINICAL KINESIOLOGY MODULE STUDENTS. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO YRS 3&4 KIN HON SPZ STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO YRS 3&4 KIN STUDENTS, KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 3402A/B or the former Kinesiology 3421A/B

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3457A - COGNITIVE ERGONOMICS
Description: Cognitive ergonomics is concerned with mental processes, such as perception, decision making, memory, reasoning, and response execution, as they affect interactions among humans and other elements of a work system. Relevant topics include skilled performance, attention, distraction, human error, work stress, risk perception, and Kansei engineering as these may relate to human-system design, safety and productivity. Assessment methodologies include hierarchical task analysis, cognitive task analysis, mental workload, human error identification/accident investigation, and situation awareness assessment.
Antirequisite(s): Kinesiology 3371A (taken in 2010-11); the former Kinesiology 4456A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES ARE ALLOCATED TO EACH YEAR. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: EQUAL ACCESS TO ALL YRS 3 & 4 KIN STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

PRIORITY TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES ARE ALLOCATED TO EACH YEAR. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: EQUAL ACCESS TO ALL YRS 3 & 4 KIN STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3463F - SPORT, THE BODY AND CULTURE
Description: This socio-cultural course explores the significance of the physicality of the body in sport by drawing upon the historical, philosophical and sociological development of sporting embodiment. Students will critically engage with unpacking various embodied issues and how these impact upon the body within the contemporary world of sport.
Antirequisite(s): The former Kinesiology 3363A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture/seminar hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS AND KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO NON-KIN STUDENTS (LIMIT 1.0). FOR DETAILS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): One of Kinesiology 2250A/B, Kinesiology 2263F/G, or Kinesiology 3362F/G.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3476F - EXERCISE & HEALTH BEHAV CHANGE
Description: This course will focus on (a) intervention grounded in behaviour change theory that positively influences physical activity in disease populations and (b) using exercise as a therapy to improve various health outcomes.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 1070A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3495B - PRACT ASPECTS STRENGTH COND
Description: The purpose of this course is to provide students with the knowledge of conduction/interpretation of assessment results, various coaching techniques, and evidence-based programming. Students who participate will be required to observe and participate in three training sessions with the Strength and Conditioning coaches responsible for training Western University varsity teams.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours, 3 lab hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2230A/B, Kinesiology 2992A/B/Y each with a minimum grade of 60% and proof of recent certification in First Aid and CPR.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3550B - KINESIOLOGY AT WORK
Description: Students will draw on knowledge gained throughout their undergraduate courses and apply them along with new concepts as we discuss common occupational injuries, basic ergonomics and occupational biomechanics.
Antirequisite(s): Kinesiology 4472B if taken in 2012-13.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours, 2 hour lab biweekly.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YR 4 KIN HONS SPZ STUDENTS.  JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO YR 3 KIN HONS SPZ STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 3890 - INTERNSHIP
Description: This course provides students with preparatory workshops and an applied professional learning experience for a period of 8-16 months at a sponsoring agency approved by the Faculty of Health Sciences. Using an application/interview process, selected students will be entered into the course once hired by external employers.
Antirequisite(s): Health Sciences 3990.
Extra information: Pass/Fail.

Credit for this course will not be given unless a minimum 8-month internship and all other mandatory components have been completed. This course may not be used as a substitute for any other course in the School of Kinesiology. On successful completion, credit for the course will be given in the year in which initial registration in the course took place.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4276G - PSYCHOLOGY OF BODY & MOVEMENT
Description: This course will explore psychological theory and application of body image as it applies to the context of kinesiology. Body image conceptualization, measurement, and intervention will be discussed, ranging from psychopathology to positive embodiment. The role of the body contextualized to movement (e.g., exercise, sport) will be a particular focus.
Extra Information: 3 lecture/seminar hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YR 4 KIN HON SPZ MODULES. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS AND YEAR 3 KIN HON SPZ. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2276F/G.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4412A - EXERCISE, IMPAIRMENT AND AGING
Description: Students will learn the role of exercise in the management of chronic disease. The focus will be on understanding the roles exercise plays for individuals with impairment and older adults (i.e. diagnosis; rehabilitation; improved health). Exercise guidelines will be examined within the context of Clinical Kinesiology and clinical practice.
Antirequisite(s): The former Kinesiology 3413A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YRS 3&4 CLINICAL KINESIOLOGY MODULE STUDENTS.  JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO YRS 3&4 KIN HON SPZ STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS.  WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 3412A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4420B - IMPACT OF EXERCISE DURING PREG
Description: Discussion of human pregnancy and the impact of exercise to prevent or treat cardiovascular disease, obesity and metabolic syndrome/type 2 diabetes will occur. The theory of the 'Thrifty phenotype' will be discussed and the mother/fetal link to chronic disease risk. Active living during pregnancy and exercise prescription will be emphasized.
Antirequisite(s): Kinesiology 4471B (if taken to 2009-10).
Extra Information: 1 lecture hour, 1 seminar hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 KIN HONS SPZ STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2222A/B or Health Sciences 2300A/B or Health Sciences 2330A/B or Anatomy and Cell Biology 2221 or Anatomy and Cell Biology 2200A/B or the former Anatomy and Cell Biology 3319; and Kinesiology 3337A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4422B - ENTREPRENEURSHIP IN CLIN'L KIN
Description: Students will focus on the business, organizational, and technological aspects of Clinical Kinesiology. The intent is to provide students with the background (and confidence) in communication, technology, and job skills in the business and entrepreneurial aspects of kinesiology.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YR 4 CLINICAL KIN MODULE. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN HON SPZ STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4430F - NEUROMUSCULAR PHYSIOLOGY
Description: This course will focus on the structure and function of skeletal muscle with a particular emphasis on muscle plasticity and the adaptive response to exercise.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.  Note: Priority to BSc(Hon) Kinesiology students.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YR 4 KIN BSC HON SPZ MODULE.  JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO YR 4 KIN HON SPZ MODULES. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS; YR 3 KIN HON SPZ. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2230A/B.

PRIORITY TO YR 4 KIN BSC HON SPZ MODULE.  JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO YR 4 KIN HON SPZ MODULES. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS; YR 3 KIN HON SPZ. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2230A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4432A - PHYSIOLOGY OF EXERCISE
Description: A study of the integration of neural, metabolic and vascular factors that compete to simultaneously regulate blood pressure and blood flow during physical exercise in health and disease.
Antirequisite(s): Physiology 4420A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.
Note: Priority to BSc Honours Specialization Kinesiology students.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YR 4 BSC KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES OPEN TO HSP PHYSIOLOGY, HSP PHYSIOLOGY & PHARMACOLOGY STUDENTS. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS  TO YR 4 KIN HON SPZ MODULES.  AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: EQUAL ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS, YR 3 KIN HSP, HSP PHYSIOLOGY, HSP PHYSIOLOGY & PHARMACOLOGY, HSP IMS, IMS MAJOR STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): (i) Physiology 1021 or equivalent, and Kinesiology 2230A/B or (ii) Physiology 3120, Physiology 3140A and either Physiology and Pharmacology 3000E or the former Physiology 3130Z.

PRIORITY TO YR 4 BSC KIN DEGREE STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES OPEN TO HSP PHYSIOLOGY, HSP PHYSIOLOGY & PHARMACOLOGY STUDENTS. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS  TO YR 4 KIN HON SPZ MODULES.  AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: EQUAL ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS, YR 3 KIN HSP, HSP PHYSIOLOGY, HSP PHYSIOLOGY & PHARMACOLOGY, HSP IMS, IMS MAJOR STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): (i) Physiology 1021 or equivalent, and Kinesiology 2230A/B or (ii) Physiology 3120, Physiology 3140A and either Physiology and Pharmacology 3000E or the former Physiology 3130Z.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4433B - PHYSIOLGY OF EXERCISE TRAINING
Description: Investigation of current knowledge of the prescription and the physiological effects of training, with emphasis on aerobic and anaerobic energy systems, strength training. Training programs for healthy adults and for sport performance are both discussed.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.  Note: Priority to BSc Honours Specialization Kinesiology students.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YR 4 KIN BSC HONS SPZ. LIMITED # OF SPACES FOR CLINICAL KIN MODULE. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO ALL YR 4 KIN HSP DEGREE STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO YR 3 KIN HONS SPZ, KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2230A/B, Kinesiology 3337A/B.

PRIORITY TO YR 4 KIN BSC HONS SPZ. LIMITED # OF SPACES FOR CLINICAL KIN MODULE. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO ALL YR 4 KIN HSP DEGREE STUDENTS. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO YR 3 KIN HONS SPZ, KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2230A/B, Kinesiology 3337A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4434B - PHYSIOL. FUNCTION IN AGING
Description: In this course, we will explore the changes that occur in various physiological systems during the aging process. The impact of these physiological changes on function and health will be discussed. We will examine how factors such as physical activity can impact the biological changes with advanced age.
Extra Information: 3 lecture/seminar hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YR 4 KIN HON SPZ MODULES. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS AND YEAR 3 KIN HON SPZ. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2230A/B.
PRIORITY TO YR 4 KIN HON SPZ MODULES. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS AND YEAR 3 KIN HON SPZ. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2230A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4437A - MEDICAL ISS IN EXERCISE & SPRT
Description: An introduction to a very broad range of selected medical topics relating to the diagnosis, treatment and rehabilitation for the active individual ranging from the 'weekend warrior' to the elite or professional athlete. The medical topic focus will give students an exposure to various aspects of care as it related to exercise and sport participation.
Antirequisite(s): Kinesiology 4473A 2008-09 and 2009-10.
Extra Information: 2 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YR 4 KIN HONS SPZ MODULES. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2236A/B and Kinesiology 3336A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4465G - SOCIAL THEORY OF SPRT & EXRCS
Description: This course will explore key concepts, theorists, and issues in the social and cultural study of sport that help us to extend such questioning by way of theorizing.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours. Online course.

Notes: ONLINE COURSE. PRIORITY TO YRS 3&4 KIN HSP STUDENTS AND KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO NON-KIN STUDENTS (1.0 LIMIT). WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 2250A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4472B - SPECIAL TOPICS IN KINESIOLOGY
Description: Selected topics in the areas of sport, exercise, play and dance. Topics and course description will be available at the Undergraduate Program Office.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: BLENDED COURSE: BOTH ONLINE AND IN-PERSON INSTRUCTION. RESTRICTED TO YRS 3&4 KIN HSP STUDENTS AND KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. TOPIC: PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AND DISABILITY. CROSS LISTED WITH HS 4090B. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Permission of Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4473A - SPECIAL TOPICS IN KINESIOLOGY
Description: Selected topics in the areas of sport, exercise, play and dance. Topic and course description will be available at the Undergraduate Program Office.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YR 4 KIN HONS SPZ STUDENTS. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS AND YR 3 KIN HONS SPZ STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE. TOPIC: LEGAL ISSUES FOR KINESIOLOGISTS
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Permission of Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4475A - SPECIAL TOPICS IN KINESIOLOGY
Description: Selected topics in the areas of sport, exercise, play and dance. Topic and course description available in the Undergraduate Program Office. Antirequisites and/or additional prerequisites to be determined based on the topic offered.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YR 4 KIN HONS SPZ STUDENTS. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. TOPIC: KINEMATICS AND DYNAMICS OF BIOMECHANICS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Permission of Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4480A - EXERCISE NEUROSCIENCE
Description: This course will examine the relationship between exercise and cognitive neuroscience. Students will be provided with an overview of fundamental methodologies used in cognitive neuroscience research before examining the literature on exercise neuroscience, with a focus on different study designs and application to various age groups and clinical populations.
Extra Information: 3 lecture/seminar hours.

Notes: PRIORITY TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN HSP DEGREE STUDENTS. LIMITED NUMBER OF SPACES ARE ALLOCATED TO EACH YEAR. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: EQUAL ACCESS TO ALL YRS 3&4 KIN HSP STUDENTS.  AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4489A - INTERNATIONAL SPORT MANAGEMENT
Description: This course provides an international perspective on sport management through a variety of blended learning modes, including, but not limited to: classroom lectures, on-line learning experiences, case study analyses, field trips and reflection activities, collaboration with professors and students from other countries, & guest speakers with experience in International Sport Management.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: BLENDED COURSE: BOTH ONLINE AND IN PERSON INSTRUCTION. . PRIORITY TO YR 4 KIN SPORT MANAGEMENT. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE:  ACCESS TO ALL YR 4 KIN HON SPZ. AUGUST 4 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): 1.0 course from: Kinesiology 2298A/B, Kinesiology 3398F/G, Kinesiology 3399F/G.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4490E - SENIOR RESEARCH PROJECT
Description: Independent research project in Kinesiology involving presentation of proposal, collection and analysis of data, presentation of results, and final written report as a scholarly paper.
Antirequisite(s): Kinesiology 4443E, Kinesiology 4444E.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 HON SPECIALIZATION KIN STUDENTS APPROVED FOR THE COURSE. REGISTRATION THROUGH THE SCHOOL OF KINESIOLOGY.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Restricted to students registered in the fourth year of the Honours Specialization Kinesiology; permission of the School of Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4491F - INDEPNDNT STUDY IN KINESIOLOGY
Description: Reading and discussion on selected topics in Kinesiology agreed upon through consultation between the student and the supervising professor. All fourth year honours Kinesiology students and, in some cases third year students, are eligible to enrol, subject to Faculty procedural guidelines and approval.

Notes: INDEPENDENT STUDY. RESTRICTED TO YR 4 KIN HON SPECIALIZATION MODULES. REGISTRATION THROUGH THE SCHOOL OF KINESIOLOGY.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Registration in fourth year Honours Specialization in Kinesiology and permission of Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4492G - INDEPNDNT STUDY IN KINESIOLOGY
Description: Reading and discussion on, or field experience in, selected topics in Kinesiology agreed upon through consultation between the student and the supervising professor. All fourth year honours Kinesiology students and, in some cases third year students, are eligible to enrol, subject to Faculty procedural guidelines and approval.

Notes: INDEPENDENT STUDY. RESTRICTED TO YR 4 KIN HON SPECIALIZATION MODULES. REGISTRATION THROUGH THE SCHOOL OF KINESIOLOGY.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Registration in fourth year Honours Specialization in Kinesiology and permission of Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4520B - CLINICAL BIOMECHANICS
Description: This course is designed to explore the theoretical basis of clinical biomechanics and develop hands-on skills necessary to work in the area. Special emphasis will be in the areas of: Posture and Balance, Gait, and Orthopaedic Biomechanics.
Antirequisite(s): Kinesiology 4475A/B, the former Kinesiology 4450A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN HONS SPZ STUDENTS AND KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): One of Kinesiology 3341A/B, 3343A/B or 3353A/B.
RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 KIN HONS SPZ STUDENTS AND KIN SPECIAL STUDENTS. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): One of Kinesiology 3341A/B, 3343A/B or 3353A/B.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4585 - ATHLETIC INJURIES PRACTICUM
Description: This course provides students with the opportunity to put theory into practice within the sport system available at Western. Students will work closely with athletic teams in assigned areas and under course-instructor supervision.

Extra Information: 3 lecture/seminar hours. Restricted to students in fourth year Honours Specialization in Kinesiology and subject to Faculty procedural guidelines and approval. Students will be permitted to take a maximum of 1.0 credits from Kinesiology 4495, Kinesiology 4498A/B, Kinesiology 4585, Kinesiology 4590, Kinesiology 4995F/G, Kinesiology 4996F/G.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 KIN HON SPZ MODULES APPROVED FOR THE COURSE. REGISTRATION THROUGH THE SCHOOL OF KINESIOLOGY.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Kinesiology 3336A/B; current certification in Emergency First Responder (EFR) Training.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4590 - CLINICAL KIN PLACEMENT
Description: This course offers students the opportunity to apply concepts and professional practice skills by gaining kinesiology experience working directly with clients/patients to optimize ‘performance’ (i.e. in sport) or ‘health’ (i.e. prevention and/or management of chronic disease and impairment).

Extra Information: One hour/week online with class/self-reflective journal/blog; two 2-hour class meetings in person every 4 weeks; Routine meetings and peer-facilitated discussions about professional experiences will encourage the development of reflective practitioners. Issues related to the intersection of theory and practice will be explored. Electronic video conferencing will be used for weekly discussions to reduce travel by students from dispersed. Students will be permitted to take a maximum of 1.0 credits from Kinesiology 4495, Kinesiology 4498A/B, Kinesiology 4585, Kinesiology 4590, Kinesiology 4995F/G, Kinesiology 4996F/G.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO CLINICAL KINESIOLOGY MODULE STUDENTS APPROVED FOR THE COURSE. REGISTRATION THROUGH THE SCHOOL OF KINESIOLOGY.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Registration in the B.A. Honours Specialization in Clinical Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4995F - PRACTICUM
Description: This course provides 4th year Honours students the opportunity to gain experience applying theoretical knowledge in a community setting, including a full range of elements that comprise the partners' operations. Students will be required to attend tutorial or seminar sessions. Applications due in the Spring of the previous year.

Extra Information: Minimum of 75 practicum contact hours and 7 seminar hours over the 13 weeks. Specific location requirements may vary. Application required. Students will be permitted to take a maximum of 1.0 credits from Kinesiology 4495, Kinesiology 4498A/B, Kinesiology 4585, Kinesiology 4590, Kinesiology 4995F/G, Kinesiology 4996F/G.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 KIN HONS SPZ STUDENTS. APPLICATION AND REGISTRATION THROUGH THE SCHOOL OF KINESIOLOGY.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Registration in fourth year of an Honors Specialization module offered by the School of Kinesiology.

Courses.Name: KINESIOL 4996G - PRACTICUM
Description: This course provides 4th year Honours students the opportunity to gain experience applying theoretical knowledge in a community setting, including a full range of elements that comprise the partners' operations. Students will be required to attend tutorial or seminar sessions. Applications due in the Spring of the previous year.

Extra Information: Minimum of 75 practicum contact hours and 7 seminar hours over the 13 weeks. Specific location requirements may vary. Application required. Students will be permitted to take a maximum of 1.0 credits from Kinesiology 4495, Kinesiology 4498A/B, Kinesiology 4585, Kinesiology 4590, Kinesiology 4995F/G, Kinesiology 4996F/G.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 KIN HONS SPZ STUDENTS. APPLICATION AND REGISTRATION THROUGH THE SCHOOL OF KINESIOLOGY.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Registration in fourth year of an Honors Specialization module offered by the School of Kinesiology.
